content.description: Start low and move up and left along cool holds to a cool lip and a hard mantle.

On the same boulder as "Mantle Man" but you start on the right side with a crystal jug and an undercling pinch. Right hand up to sloper left hand out to rail and drop left foot out to water level rail, bring in right hand to sharp micro crimp directly above left hand rail, bump left hand out to square crystal crimp, heel hook pinch start to bump right down to the same rail below micro crimp, drop heel and switch to toe on rail at hips height, move right hand up to obvious side pull, begin standing on right toe and move left to to little tooth below right foots rail, bump right hand up to terrible crimp and bump again for a small but positive crimp about a foot from the lip, reach or jump for lip horn.
content.protection: None, theres three feet of water and sand at the bottom
content.location: Same boulder as "Mantle Man" but on the right of the flat face.

content.description: Start in the cave on a great rail at chest height. Big move to sloper rail then up edges to lip and top out. Solid rock. Great holds!

Sit start at the left corner of the boulder. Pull on with a left hand undercling and a right hand crimp, feet may be a bit scrunched for taller folks. Once pulled on, bump your left hand up through the undercling feature. Bring right hand up to either a sidepull crimp or a thin flat crimp rail. The crux is bumping your left hand to the slopey lip from this position. A subtle toe hook is possible. Easy top out and makes a good warm up before getting on Rapture.
content.location: When approaching from the pull off it is one of the first boulders you'll see. The top is visible from the road and you'll likely walk to the right of it just before heading up through the talus.

content.description: Cool lip traverse. Start at low crimp rail and follow jugs, crimps and slopers up the left diagonaling lip of the boulder.
content.location: Starts right of Rapture and finishes into it.

content.description: A large boulder covered talus slope below the cliff line. It runs from the road to the base of the cliff. There are several large boulders offering some stellar problems.
